intro: Erigeron ellisii, commonly known as Ellis' fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. Its foliage consists of narrow, gray-green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs.
